ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: It was a comfortable and safe environment to write my first college papers, and I became much more confident when writing longer page counts. The research paper was also very helpful practice for the future.
I learned how to collect my thoughts and write them in a smooth manner.
I discovered the best practices for writing college-level essays.
Aside from learning a lot about mindreading in the context of social cognition, I learned a lot about connecting findings from varied studies to address somewhat unfamiliar research topics.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really enjoyed the writing element to our course, but I think that the topic of mind reading is slightly difficult to build a cohesive course structure around. I do think I learned a lot about mind reading, but sometimes it seemed like the complexity of the topic got in the way of my progress in my writing.

A strength was the Professor's ability to engage her students while understanding the struggles of switching to college life. A weakness might be that some of the readings were too complex for a common first-year to understand (though we went through each one well in class).
I rather liked this class; the in-class discourse and writing exercises really helped polish my writing skills and lent new perspectives on familiar topics.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! We had a really great atmosphere in seminar, and it was much less stressful than my other classes. All in all, a great class to take when starting out college.
I would definitely recommend if you want to practice and get better at writing! You also learn a lot from the world of psychology.
Most definitely! Prof. Holt is really nice and will assist you throughout your creative process.
